column4: I just find it really strange that it just cant detect a VGA monitor in a DVI input, when other OS can... unless ive missed something!
Which graphics cards, Gnome or KDE?
can you get the output of the xrandr command somewhere (e.g. a pastebin) and have you tried another VGA->DVI cable?
whats xrandr?
xrandr is a program that manages the X server resolution settings these days
Tell me a bit more - that says you have 2240x1200 resolution - that sounds great - what have you really got?
Atm, i have 2 CRTs connected to my machine. One has a resolution of 1280x960, the other 1600x1200. However can only see out of the 1600x1200 (that is connected to VGA)
Ah OK, what type of graphics card? also on the monitor that it doesn't get right is it a normal VGA lead at the monitor end?
Does it help if you swap the two monitors?
let me try that now.
sigh, monitor out of frequency
On both of them?
only this display configuration works

My suspicion is that either the DVI->VGA adapter or the CRT monitor you have on that monitor is blocking the EDID signals that let the card figure out the res of the monitor; you'll have to tell it the sync range manually
that could be it, ill just have to learn more about these things.
I have a similar problem in that my external monitor doesn't do EDID for no apparent reason
oh right, still curious how I could get a display last night, but now I cant..
Ah not sure, since it's the nvidia it'll be a bit different from what I used to, since they don't do it the same way as the open source stuff
yeah regretting getting an nVidia card. Their drivers are known to be terrible.
If you want dual head it's nvidia or ati and they're both dodgy
Ive actually encountered this many times, I found that my resolutions pretty much set themselves how they felt like on Ubuntu 9.04 and LinuxMint 7
